item.title: Numpy Exercises
item.description: import numpy as np # 1. Creating array object arr = np.array( [[ 1, 2, 3], [ 4, 2, 5]] ) # Printing type of arr object print("Array is of type: ", type(arr)) # Printing array dimensions (axes) print("No. of dimensions: ", arr.ndim) # Printing shape of array print("Shape of array: ", arr.shape) # Printing size (total number of elements) of array print("Size of array: ", arr.

item.title: Numpy Exercises
item.description: import numpy as np # 1. Creating array object arr = np.array( [[ 1, 2, 3], [ 4, 2, 5]] ) # Printing type of arr object print("Array is of type: ", type(arr)) # Printing array dimensions (axes) print("No. of dimensions: ", arr.ndim) # Printing shape of array print("Shape of array: ", arr.shape) # Printing size (total number of elements) of array print("Size of array: ", arr.

item.title: Confusion Matrix
item.description: from sklearn.metrics import confusion_matrix var1 = "Cat" var2 = "Ant" var3 = "Bird"true = [var3, var1, var3, var3, var1, var2] pred = [var1, var1, var3, var3, var1, var3]confusion_matrix(true, pred, labels=[var1, var2, var3]) array([[2, 0, 0], [0, 0, 1], [1, 0, 2]])

item.title: Custom Function
item.description: import pandas as pddata = ['Vachitaya aapuuuuuuuuu','Sing in the rain' ,'Great power comes wih great '] df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns = ['Sent']) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } Sent 0 Vachitaya aapuuuuuuuuu 1 Sing in the rain 2 Great power comes wih great def sent_length(message): return (len(message))df['len'] = df['Sent'].

item.title: Label Encoder
item.description: import pandas as pdcontent = ['ham','spam','ham']df=pd.DataFrame(content,columns={'Sms content'}) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } Sms content 0 ham 1 spam 2 ham # encode from sklearn import preprocessing encode = preprocessing.LabelEncoder() df['find spam'] = encode.fit_transform(df['Sms content']) df .

item.title: Lambda Function
item.description: import pandas as pdcontent = ['hi','hello','how are you']df=pd.DataFrame(content,columns={'Sms content'}) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } Sms content 0 hi 1 hello 2 how are you df['msg_length'] = df['Sms content'].apply(lambda x:len(x)) df.head() .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .

item.title: Post Stemmer
item.description: from nltk.stem import PorterStemmer e_words= ["wait", "waiting", "waited", "waits"] ps =PorterStemmer() for w in e_words: rootWord=ps.stem(w) print(rootWord) wait wait wait wait

item.title: Remove Punctuation
item.description: import pandas as pdcontent = ['hey!','great..','nice@']df=pd.DataFrame(content,columns={'Sms content'}) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } Sms content 0 hey! 1 great.. 2 nice@ import string string.punctuation def remove_punctuation(text): new_text=''.join([char for char in text if char not in string.punctuation]) return new_textdf['new_sms']=df['Sms content'].

item.title: Remove Stopwords
item.description: import pandas as pdcontent = ['hey i am your boss!','he is great..','nice@']df=pd.DataFrame(content,columns={'Sms content'}) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } Sms content 0 hey i am your boss! 1 he is great.. 2 nice@ import nltk nltk.download('stopwords') stopwords=nltk.

item.title: Rename Column
item.description: import pandas as pddata = ['Database team','ML team' ,'Flask team'] df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns = ['Team']) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } Team 0 Database team 1 ML team 2 Flask team df.columns=['Intern Team'] df .

item.title: Scikit Learn notes
item.description: # 1. Enhances contrast in large almost uniform regions. import skimage from skimage import data from skimage import exposure from matplotlib import pyplot as plt camera = data.camera() camera_equalized = exposure.equalize_hist(camera) plt.imshow(camera_equalized) <matplotlib.image.AxesImage at 0x7f60bd119fd0> # 2. Data Set reading from sklearn import datasets # Load data iris= datasets.load_iris() # Print shape of data to confirm data is loaded print(iris.data.shape) (150, 4) # 3. Train and Test Split X = iris.

item.title: Tokenisation
item.description: import pandas as pdcontent = ['hey boss!','great..','nice@']df=pd.DataFrame(content,columns={'Sms content'}) df .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type { vertical-align: middle; } .dataframe tbody tr th { vertical-align: top; } .dataframe thead th { text-align: right; } Sms content 0 hey boss! 1 great.. 2 nice@ import re def tokenize(text): tokens=re.split('\W+',text) return tokensdf['tokenized_text']=df['Sms content'].apply(lambda row : tokenize(row.lower())) df.head() .

item.title: Unique Function
item.description: import pandas as pdpd.Series([2, 4, 3, 3], name='P').unique() array([2, 4, 3])

item.title: f1 Score
item.description: from sklearn.metrics import f1_scoretrue = [0, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2] pred = [0, 2, 1, 0, 0, 1]f1_score(true, pred, average='macro') 0.26666666666666666 f1_score(true, pred, average='micro') 0.3333333333333333 f1_score(true, pred, average='weighted') 0.26666666666666666
